Summary: Animate component properties between states in MauiReactor using `WithAnimation()` for simple tweened transitions, or custom MAUI animations for advanced cases.
Remarks: Property-based animation (aka RxAnimation) animates control properties as component state changes. In MauiReactor, calling `.WithAnimation()` on a component enables tweening for any animatable properties set before it (e.g., `.Opacity(...)`, `.Scale(...)`, `.TranslationX(...)`). By default, animations use a 600ms duration and Linear easing; you can pass custom duration and easing to `WithAnimation(...)` to control timing curves. For standard MAUI animations (e.g., `FadeTo`, `ScaleTo`), you can still use them by obtaining a native control reference and invoking MAUI's methods directly. Prefer declarative property-based animation for state-driven UI transitions; choose imperative MAUI animations when you need sequences, cancellation, or specialized control beyond default animatable properties. Animate only the properties necessary to communicate state; avoid over-animating for clarity and performance.
